sentence.Network_en: He glanced admiringly at the design.
sentence.Network_cn: 他钦佩地看了看那个设计。

sentence.Network_en: He looked at it admiringly. " That dog will cost you ten dollars. "
sentence.Network_cn: 老头用赞赏的神气看着它, “ 这只狗要十美元. ”

sentence.Network_en: A moment later he says admiringly, " that tracking system is amazing. "
sentence.Network_cn: 过了一会儿,他赞叹道, “ 那个跟踪系统真了不起. ”

Chinese... ... admiration for 对...赞赏 ... admiringly adv. 钦佩地,羡慕地 ... admissibility n. 可容许,有入场的资格.
he looked at his wife admiringly ., 他赞赏地看着他妻子.

list.abs: A moment later he says admiringly , " that tracking system is amazing . ", 过了一会儿 , 他赞叹道 , " 那个跟踪系统真了不起 . "
To look at admiringly or invitingly ., 羡慕地或被吸引地看着.

RelatedPhrase.word: look at oneself in the mirror admiringly

list.key: look at oneself in the mirror admiringly
list.abs: satisfy one’s eyes 悦目look at oneself in the mirror admiringly 在镜中自我欣赏appreciate the picture with staring eyes 目不转睛地欣赏着这幅画
The beautiful thing on the world often fondle admiringly ., 世上美的东西往往令人爱不释手.

entry.def: An admiring expression shows that you like or respect someone or something.

example.ex: He cast her an admiring glance...
example.tran: 他向她投以钦慕的目光。

example.ex: Within moments, he'd attracted an admiring audience.
example.tran: 不出片刻，他就赢得了全场观众的倾心。

auth_sentence.content: I think I prefer yours, he says admiringly.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think I prefer yours, he says admiringly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think I prefer yours, he says admiringly.

auth_sentence.content: Huffington's friends speak admiringly of her conquests.
